business.headline: RBI raises UPI Lite, UPI 123Pay limits at MPC: How it affects your walletRBI MPC meeting: The central bank raised the transaction limits for two key UPI services—UPI 123Pay and UPI Lite—offering more convenience for millions of users.

RBI MPC meeting: Key takeaways on GDP growth, inflation, and interest rateRBI MPC meeting: The committee led by Governor Shaktikanta Das decided to keep interest rates unchanged and shifted its policy stance from 'withdrawal of accommodation' to 'neutral'.
Stock market rally: Sensex surges 600 points as RBI holds repo rate The S&P BSE Sensex added 591.46 points to 82,225.81, while the NIfty50 gained 197 points to 25,210.15.
Hyundai Motor IPO opens on October 15: All you need to know Hyundai Motor India aims to raise Rs 27,855 crore, making it the largest IPO in the history of the Indian stock market.

RBI keeps repo rate unchanged at 6.5%, GDP for FY25 projected at 7.2% RBI Monetary Policy Meeting: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has decided to leave policy rates unchanged, maintaining the current levels. However, it has adjusted its stance to a neutral position.
Sensex, Nifty open higher ahead of RBI decision; Tata Motors stock gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 129.72 points to 81,764.53, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 46.35 points to 25,059.50.

Gold, silver price today, October 9, 2024: Yellow metal records dip, silver trades higher on MCXGold Price Today 9 October 2024: Gold is trading on the lower side while silver rates have recorded a hike on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Wednesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

US aviation agency issues safety alert over Boeing 737 rudder issueAlert comes after National Transportation Safety Board says foreign airlines could be using planes with rudder components that could pose safety risks
Paytm shares rally 18% in last-hour surge: Is there more upside? Despite the rally in shares, Paytm's stock is still down 24.51% from its 52-week high of Rs 998.30, recorded on August 20, 2023.

More trouble for Ola Electric, transport ministry to investigate complaintsThe complaints against Ola Electric have been growing in recent months, with issues ranging from service quality, customer support, to product reliability.
Sensex, Nifty end higher led by auto and financial; Paytm shares jump 16%The S&P BSE Sensex added 584.81 points to end at 81,634.81, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 217.40 points to close at 25,013.15.

Tata Group stock falls 4% as Jhunjhunwala eyes exit from multibaggerThe Jhunjhunwala family first invested in Tata Motors in the September 2020 quarter, when Rakesh Jhunjhunwala picked up 4 crore shares of the company

Explained: Why SpiceJet shares jumped 9% todaySpiceJet recently raised Rs 3,000 crore through a qualified institutional placement (QIP). The airline is also set to receive an additional Rs 736 crore from a previous funding round, which will help support its growth plans.

Cognizant favoured H-1B holders over non-Indian workers, says US juryThis case dates back to 2017 when a class-action lawsuit was filed against the IT giant, accusing it of bias in its employment practices.
Crude oil prices seem to stabilise as all-out war fears recedeTensions between Israel and Iran led to a 13 per cent spurt in Brent crude prices in the past seven days.

Stock market reacts to China stimulus: Is there further dip in Sensex, Nifty?Despite some analysts hoping that foreign portfolio investment (FPI) outflows from India might reverse, further declines in Indian stocks cannot be dismissed, as per experts.
Ola Electric shares fall 6% after show cause notice; drops 46% from peakOla Electric has been given 15 days to respond to the notice and will provide the required documents within that time frame.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as global uncertainty fuels cautious sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 321.03 points to 81,371.03, while the Nifty50 added 73.45 points to 24,869.20.

Central panel's notice to Ola after surge in complaints against EVs: SourcesThe Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has taken cognisance of thousands of complaints and issued a show-cause notice to Ola Electric, sources said.

RBI MPC: Is rate cut on card? Shaktikanta Das to announce soonSpeculation has grown about the possibility of a rate cut or a shift in monetary policy, especially after the US Federal Reserve delivered an unexpected 50-basis-point cut in September 2024.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Day after loss, Rahul Gandhi says party analysing unexpected Haryana resultCongress MP Rahul Gandhi broke his silence on his party's poor showing in Haryana and said the party was analysing the "unexpected result", while flagging complaints of vote counting irregularities in some Assembly seats.

Facing strong anti-incumbency in Haryana, BJP turned to RSS for helpBJP defied exit polls and early trends in Haryana and won 48 seats in the 90-member Assembly. Congress, which once looked in pole position to dethrone the saffron party, only managed to muster 37 seats.

2 jawans kidnapped in J&K, one found dead with bullet wounds, other escapesTwo Army jawans were kidnapped during an anti-terror operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Wednesday. One of them escaped with bullet injuries, while the other was found dead in a forest.

PM meets victorious Nayab Saini day after BJP pulls Haryana hat-trickThe meeting between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini came amid the possibility of Saini being asked to continue in his post after the BJP's stunning performance in the Haryana Assembly polls.

Rajdeep Sardesai's big takeaways from BJP's Haryana win, J&K resultsIn Haryana, the BJP's performance this year has surpassed its 2014 breakthrough, when it first came to power on its own, and in Jammu and Kashmir, the Farooq Abdullah-led NC led the alliance to victory by winning 42 seats.

Omar Abdullah's message to ally Congress after Haryana shocker, poor J&K showDespite the INDIA bloc securing a victory in the J&K Assembly polls, the National Conference did the heavy lifting and carried the alliance.

FedEx's advisory after India Today journalist's digital arrest ordealFraudsters impersonating employees of courier companies to lure the victim into transferring money has emerged as a worrying trend. FedEx has issued an advisory on how to deal with such scams.

The Ram Rahim factor in Haryana election resultsWhen Gurmeet Ram Rahim was granted parole for the fifteenth time, there was a lot of criticism aimed at the BJP, which was accused of seeking the support of Dera Sacha Sauda chief.

Harsh Goenka's 'one kamra to another' post amid comedian-Ola boss spatHarsh Goenka has shared a picture of himself riding an Ola electric scooter with a witty caption amid the ongoing online spat between comedian Kunal Kamra and Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal.

Arrogance, over-confidence: INDIA allies slam Congress over Haryana poll defeatThe BJP has secured a third historic term in Haryana after winning 48 out of the 90 Assembly seats. While Congress won 37 seats, the Indian National Lok Dal (INLD) secured two and Independent candidates three.

RBI MPC meeting: Key takeaways on GDP growth, inflation, and interest rateRBI MPC meeting: The committee led by Governor Shaktikanta Das decided to keep interest rates unchanged and shifted its policy stance from 'withdrawal of accommodation' to 'neutral'.

Haryana Shocker: A BJP win, a Congress self-goalSo how did the BJP, written off by everyone, including privately by some of their own leaders, pull off a stunning upset against the odds and, in the face of a 10-year anti-incumbency score, a remarkable hat trick?

Why taking your phone to the loo can give you lifelong problemsWhen you take your phone to the washroom, you are likely to spend more time on the toilet seat. This prolonged sitting can lead to serious health issues like haemorrhoids.

Analyst Amitabh Tiwari's key takeaways from Haryana, J&K resultsIn Haryana, the BJP got 48 Assembly seats, crossing the majority mark of 46, while the National Conference-Congress combine in Jammu and Kashmir also secured 48.

Diplomacy can't be done with lies: Maldives's Muizzu mocked over U-turn on IndiaMaldives President Mohamed Muizzu, who is currently in India, was mocked by his country's opposition leaders, who said that his administration had now realised that diplomacy could not be done through "lies and deceit".

First Odisha, now Haryana: Dharmendra Pradhan delivers big for BJPDharmendra Pradhan's strategic grassroots approach and focus on party unity have led the BJP to a historic third-term victory in Haryana, securing 48 out of 90 Assembly seats.

How Hurricane Milton exploded into a Category 5 storm in 24 hoursMilton's wind speeds surged from 120 kmph to a staggering 280 kmph in just 12 hours, marking one of the most rapid intensifications on record.

Netanyahu's 'take back your country' message to Lebanon amid Hezbollah conflictCalling Lebanon "once the pearl of Middle East known for its tolerance and beauty", Netanyahu urged the people to take back their country, which "Hezbollah has turned into a stockpile of ammunition and a forward Iranian military base".

Why the knives are out for Congress in INDIAThe twin election results on Tuesday brought back two sore points for the Congress. The party needed allies to climb to power in states, and it failed in straight fights with the BJP. This has been noticed by its INDIA bloc partners, and the knives are out before the polls in Maharashtra, Jharkhand and Delhi.

Ben Stokes backs Joe Root to break Sachin Tendulkar's record for most Test runsEngland captain Ben Stokes has backed Joe Root to go on and break Sachin Tendulkar's record for the most runs in Tests. Root went past Alastair Cook to become England's leading run-getter in the longest format of the game on October 9, Wednesday.

'Fabulous Lives vs…' trailer: Ranbir is sure sister Riddhima will 'mess it up'The trailer for Season 3 of Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives is out, showcasing drama and glamour as wealthy women navigate social lives in Delhi and Mumbai. The show will premiere on October 18 on Netflix.

US millionaire on anti-ageing quest sparks confusion with Hindi hashtag in postA US millionaire known for his anti-ageing tips hinted at a trip to India in a post on X, but his attempt at using a Hindi hashtag prompted social media users to react.

Israel widens ground operations in Lebanon as it continues striking BeirutIsrael Hezbollah War Live Updates: The Israeli military widened its ground offensive by sending more troops into Lebanon as it continued pounding strikes in the Lebanese capital Beirut's southern suburbs, a stronghold of the group. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israeli airstrikes had killed two successors to Hezbollah's slain leader, as Israel expanded its ground offensive against the Iran-backed group with a fourth army division deployed into south Lebanon. Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant said Hashem Safieddine, the man expected to succeed Nasrallah, had probably been "eliminated". It was not immediately clear what Netanyahu meant by the "replacement of the replacement".

Triptii Dimri cried for days after backlash for Animal: I got mad thinking...Triptii Dimri faced criticism for her role in Animal, after which she cried for days. She shared that while it was tough, she learnt it's okay to cry to release trauma. She will soon be seen in Vicky Vidya Ka Woh Wala Video.

KBC 16: Junaid Khan's response to Big B about his love life stuns AamirBollywood star Aamir Khan will soon be gracing the episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati 16 with his son and actor Junaid Khan. In a recent promo, host Amitabh Bachchan was seen playfully interrogating Junaid about his personal life.
Veteran Malayalam actor TP Madhavan dies at 88Veteran Malayalam actor TP Madhavan died at 88. Known for his versatility, he acted in over 600 films and was the first General Secretary of AMMA.

'Fabulous Lives vs…' trailer: Ranbir is sure sister Riddhima will 'mess it up'The trailer for Season 3 of Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives is out, showcasing drama and glamour as wealthy women navigate social lives in Delhi and Mumbai. The show will premiere on October 18 on Netflix.

Rishab Shetty on National Award win: Motivation for upcoming actors, filmmakersKannada actor Rishab Shetty reflected on his Best Actor win at the 70th National Film Awards and how it boosts recognition for regional cinema.

Kaspersky shutting down UK office, laying of thousands of employees Kaspersky is closing its UK office and laying off staff as it shifts its business strategy. Despite challenges, it remains committed to serving its European customers through partner networks.

Panasonic Lumix S9 review: Made for creators and Insta-worthy reelsThe Panasonic Lumix S9 is a compact full-frame camera that content creators who need a good quality shooter for high quality videos and photos can keep in their backpack. However, given its focus on videos, it might not woo the prosumer photographers.

iQOO 13 to launch soon, front look officially revealedThe iQOO 13 is likely to launch soon as the company has started teasing its next flagship phone. iQOO has released a teaser image, showing the front design of the iQOO 13. This confirms that the next-gen flagship from iQOO could debut with a fresh look.
Logitech launches new Pop Icon Keys and Mouse combo in India Logitech has unveiled its new POP Icon Keys and Mouse combo in India, featuring customisable options and support for multiple devices.

sports.headline: Ex-Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp named Red Bull's global head of footballJurgen Klopp will advise the Red Bull network of clubs, including Leipzig in Germany and Salzburg in Austria, on key areas, including transfers and playing style. The 57-year-old German landed his first job since quitting as Liverpool coach at the end of the 2023-24 season.

Root went past Alastair Cook to become England's leading run-getter in the longest format of the game on October 9, Wednesday.

Joe Root goes past Alastair Cook to become England's leading run-getter in TestsPakistan vs England: Joe Root went past Alastair Cook to become England's leading run-getter in Test cricket. He achieved the milestone on Day 3 of the first Test against Pakistan in Multan on October 9.

Mohammadreza Chiyaneh key for Haryana Steelers in season 11Big-money signing Mohammadreza Chiyaneh will be the key man for Haryana Steelers as they aim to finally win the Pro Kabaddi League title in season 11 of the competition.

Watch: Rohit Sharma stops car on busy road, wishes female fan on her birthdayIn a video that is going viral on social media, India cricket superstar Rohit Sharma was seen stopping his luxury car on a busy road and wished a female fan on her birthday. Rohit was returning home from a training session in Mumbai.

Want Joe Root, Ben Stokes in England squad for Champions Trophy: Eoin MorganEoin Morgan has said that he wants to see both Joe Root and Eoin Morgan be a part of the England squad for the ICC Champions Trophy in Pakistan. Root and Stokes have been away from the ODI team since World Cup 2023.

Paralympics gold medallist Sumit Antil wants to break 80m barrier in IndiaParis Paralympics gold medallist and world record holder in men's javelin F64 event, Sumit Antil, said that he wanted to break the 80m barrier in India. In an exclusive interview with India Today, Sumit spoke about his Games Village experience in Paris and the Indian sporting ecosystem.

Liverpool's Ibrahim Konate ready to support player strike over hectic scheduleLiverpool defender Ibrahim Konate has become the latest player to support a strike over the hectic football schedule. The ongoing season has seen an increase in games due to the remodelled European competitions and international matches.

Watch: Marnus Labuschagne stuns umpire with unique field setting in own overSheffield Shield: Queensland captain Marnus Labuschagne bowled an entertaining three-over spell on Day 1 of their clash against Western Australia on Tuesday, October 8. Labuschagne stunned the on-field umpire by setting a fielder directly behind him.

Cole Palmer beats Bellingham, Saka to be England fans' Player Of The YearCole Palmer defeated Jude Bellingham and Bukayo Saka to be voted as the England fans' Player Of The Year for the 2023-24 season. Palmer ended Saka's winning streak of the award.

India's Rishabh Pant will have a big Border Gavaskar Trophy: Shane WatsonShane Watson has claimed that Rishabh Pant will have a big Border Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia, after making a triumphant return to the Test format. Pant has been a hero for India during their last 2 tours in Australia.

Arshdeep Singh not thinking about Test debut, enjoying highs and lows of gameIndia pacer Arshdeep Singh isn't focusing too much on when he will finally get to make his Test debut and is just aiming to enjoy the game and its highs and lows. Arshdeep has been a name mentioned by fans and pundits to be in the running for a spot in India's Test team.

Hardik Pandya's 'swag' return: RP Singh warns fans not to get too excitedRP Singh has warned the fans to not get too excited about Hardik Pandya's 'swag' return to the Indian team during the 1st T20I against Bangladesh. Hardik played a whirlwind knock with the bat and delivered 4 overs with the ball.

Nervous India search for much-needed intent in Sri Lanka clashWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: Harmanpreet Kaur's India have plenty to look forward to when they face a struggling Sri Lanka in their penultimate group match on Wednesday in Dubai.

IND vs NZ: Kane Williamson set to miss start of series due to groin injuryNew Zealand were dealt with a huge blow as star batter Kane Williamson is all set to miss the start of the Test series against India with a groin strain. The Blackcaps announced their squad on October 9, Wednesday.

2nd T20I: Young India eye series win, Bangladesh look for turnaroundIndia vs Bangladesh, 2nd T20I: India secured a dominant win over Bangladesh in the first T20I at Gwalior, taking a 1-0 lead in the series. The action now shifts to Delhi, where Bangladesh must step up to keep the series alive.

Smriti Mandhana brushes aside NRR concerns ahead of Sri Lanka clashWomen's T20 World Cup: Vice-captain Smriti Mandhana fended off India's concern regarding their Net Run Rate before squaring off against Sri Lanka in the ongoing Women's T20 World Cup.

Pooja Vastrakar's availability not known yet: Smriti Mandhana ahead of IND vs SLWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: Smriti Mandhana in the pre-match press-conference informed that there is still no clarity over pacer Pooja Vastrakar's availability for the Group A clash against Sri Lanka.

Smriti Mandhana brushes aside NRR concerns ahead of Sri Lanka clashWomen's T20 World Cup: Vice-captain Smriti Mandhana fended off India's concern regarding their Net Run Rate before squaring off against Sri Lanka in the ongoing Women's T20 World Cup.

PV Sindhu out, Malvika stuns World No.23 Yun to reach pre-quartersArctic Open Super 500 tournament: Malvika Bansod defeated world No. 23 Sung Shuo Yun, advancing to the pre-quarterfinals. Meanwhile, PV Sindhu faced an early exit, and Aakarshi Kashyap moved to the next round.

Sri Lanka have plans for Indian batters, says Chamari ahead of crunch T20 World Cup clashSri Lankan captain Chamari Athapaththu said that the team has plans for the Indian batters ahead of the all-important clash of Women's T20 World Cup 2024.
Oscar Bruzon appointed head coach of East BengalSpanish football manager Oscar Bruzon has been appointed as the head coach of East Bengal FC, the club announced on Tuesday.

Mohammed Shami yet to attain match fitness, Saha returns for BengalStar Indian fast bowler Mohammed Shami is yet to regain full match fitness, remaining out of Bengal's squad for their opening Ranji Trophy fixtures.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
